Example: This passed week I watched 'Water for Elephants' with some friends. Missionary friends - so there was a huge debate about whether we should watch a movie about adultery....Hello? Do you READ the story of David and Bath....sheba? Just cause the story contains something morally questionable doesn't mean it doesn't have value. As it is we watched the movie and it was pretty good. There is a lot you could discuss from it. The state of abusive marriages and how we should handle it for one thing. There is value there, but it depends on our attitude. If you're just going to be entertained......I don't know...what's the point then?

sure, I'm not going to go so far as to say secular entertainment is sin. That would be a stretch I think (even in the definition) but I can gaurantee that if you listen to more depressed or angry music even if you don't seem angry or down... those lyrics just cycle constantly in your head... But if replaced by worship music... wouldnt that be better?

What Nicole and I have started doing is having supper at the table. No more in front of the TV. We eat, chat and then when we're done we have "Bible Time" now. We're going through material and reading together. That has cut our TV time a lot and it's been awesome I must admit.
@jonobarton when "to be entertained" is the driving force in 95% of people's lives, then i would say that's a pretty poor show.

Consider the OT stories. Many of them rival modern entertainment when it comes to violence, deception and sex amongst other things. Yet they hold value in what we can learn from them. About God, about ourselves and about the world. I think we should approach so called 'secular' entertainment in a similar fashion. That's not to say there shouldn't be a moral line (I'm not advocating watching porn here guys, sorry!) - We are what we think - and those thoughts can and do get molded by what we see and hear.
There is no such thing really as secular entertainment. That's a flaw in recent church thing, separating spiritual and secular. All things relate in some way to our whole being, mind, body and soul.
